did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Howard Judson Hall, born in 1869, was a professor of English, the first librarian at the University of Arizona, and acting University of Arizona President, 1903. The collection includes letters, reports and other miscellaneous papers.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Howard Judson Hall, born in 1869, was a professor of English, the first librarian at the University of Arizona, and acting University of Arizona President, 1903.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is grouped into miscellaneous subjects.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection includes letters, reports and other miscellaneous papers. Includes letters to University of Arizona presidents Comstock, Billman, Parker and Adams. Also includes correspondence regarding plans for the New Library and Museum Building.

relatedmaterial.p: Also refer to AZ 427 for information on development of the University Library during Mr. Hall's term of service.
